data.title: Asia Maritime Transparency Initiative
data.meta_description: The center of gravity in world affairs has shifted to Asia. No other region will do more to determine whether the 21st century will be a peaceful one.
data.text:
Intrusions by Chinese military aircraft into Taiwan’s air defense identification zone (ADIZ) have increased dramatically in the last four years, contributing to global fears about a potential conflict in the Taiwan Strait. Amidst this historic upturn, Japan in April reported the lowest annual number of air scrambles responding to foreign military activity within its ADIZ […] Continue Reading

•

Island Tracker

Five claimants occupy nearly 70 disputed reefs and islets spread across the South China Sea. They have built more than 90 outposts on these contested features, many of which have seen expansion in recent years.

Explore the database by selecting a claimant below.

Maps of the Asia Pacific

AMTI’s interactive maps strive to provide the most complete, accurate, and up-to-date source of geospatial information on maritime Asia.
